In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

You can use the `lowercase`, `strip` and `replace` functions in Julia to clean a column name. Here is how you could define such a function:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    col = lowercase(col) # Convert to lowercase
    col = strip(col) # Remove leading/trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, " " => "_") # Replace spaces with underscores
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_") # Replace hyphens with underscores
    return col
end
```

This function takes a string `col` as an argument and returns the cleaned version of it. The `lowercase` function converts all upper case characters in a string to lower case. The `strip` function removes any leading or trailing whitespace from a string. The `replace` function replaces substrings in a string.
  
Here is how you can use this function:

```julia
col = "My Column"
cleaned_col = clean_column(col)
println(cleaned_col) # prints "my_column"
```
